<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Performs a post-encoding step on a &#96;LD&#96; or &#96;ST&#96; instruction.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The encoding of the LD/ST family of instructions is inconsistent w.r.t</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the pointer register and the addressing mode.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The permutations of the format are as followed:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ld Rd, X    &#96;1001 000d dddd 1100&#96;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ld Rd, X+   &#96;1001 000d dddd 1101&#96;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ld Rd, -X   &#96;1001 000d dddd 1110&#96;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="47"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ld Rd, Y    &#96;1000 000d dddd 1000&#96;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ld Rd, Y+   &#96;1001 000d dddd 1001&#96;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ld Rd, -Y   &#96;1001 000d dddd 1010&#96;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="51"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="52"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ld Rd, Z    &#96;1000 000d dddd 0000&#96;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="53"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ld Rd, Z+   &#96;1001 000d dddd 0001&#96;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="54"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ld Rd, -Z   &#96;1001 000d dddd 0010&#96;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="55"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///                 ^</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="56"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///                 |</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="57"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Note this one inconsistent bit - it is 1 sometimes and 0 at other times.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="58"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// There is no logical pattern. Looking at a truth table, the following</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="59"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// formula can be derived to fit the pattern:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="60"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="61"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// &#96;&#96;&#96;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="62"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// inconsistent&#95;bit = is&#95;predec OR is&#95;postinc OR is&#95;reg&#95;x</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="63"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// &#96;&#96;&#96;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// We manually set this bit in this post encoder method.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlight">AVRMCCodeEmitter::loadStorePostEncoder(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MCInst &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> EncodedValue,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Check if we need to set the inconsistent bit</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85"><span class="doxyHighlight">    EncodedValue |= (1 &lt;&lt; 12);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Encode the pointer register.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="88"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">switch</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/lib/codegen/globalisel/irtranslator-cpp/#abe44dfdea65b4f7e11e0a608ab708b76">MI</a>.getOperand(Idx).getReg()) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="90"><span class="doxyHighlight">    EncodedValue |= 0xc;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="91"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">break</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
